alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morris County through 545 PM EDT... At 516 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kinnelon, or near Pompton Lakes, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Green Pond, Pequannock Township, Parsippany and Lake Telemark. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 44 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 42 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
